full_threads.body:
Hi Michelle, 

Sure, confirming this has been updated now as well. I saw the FB ad running. Hopefully it gets some traction. It will be great for parents trying to keep their little ones mentally stimulated.

Thanks Heath! One last change for the time being please: can the button on the left panel say ‘Subscribe now’ like the one in the right panel, rather than ‘click for instant access’.
Cheers
Michelle

From: Heath Maguire <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: Saturday, March 21, 2020 5:11 PM
To: Michelle Mowbray <michelle@readytoread.com.au>
Subject: Re: On-Demand - monthly direct debit

Hi Michelle,

Sure, I have made the updates.

It’s not possible to have them fill in their name and email on that page and have it ‘follow with them’ to the checkout page. So I have put just the button (this is known to reduce checkout friction by the way).

Regarding the cart page, to move the upsells before the proceed to cart is also a bit of a work around, so I recommend we leave that as is… It’s core functionality of WooCommerce and quite detailed to override.

Regarding the extra products, yes these can be updated in due course and we can also make the shop/store page more obvious in the navigation too once more products are loaded up.

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271

<https://wolfiq.com.au/>


> On 21 Mar 2020, at 4:57 pm, Michelle Mowbray <michelle@readytoread.com.au <mailto:michelle@readytoread.com.au>> wrote:
>
> Hi Heath
> This looks good; however I’d like to have a ‘subscribe now’ button on the left as well and have them start the process above the fold… therefore could you please change the left panel To:
>
> Parent/carer first name:
> Email:
> Subscribe now <button> - then the above info carries through to cart page
> No lock in contract <make this text smaller than the rest>
> <current Lah-Lah image etc.>
>
> On the right panel, please change the first point to ‘Family subscription for just $5 per month’
>
> On the cart page, please move the sound chart call to action above the final ‘proceed to cart’ totals and button.
>
> We’re planning to add some reading and activity books to the online store, so we’ll update this call to action at that point. Since we’re using this month’s allowance already, perhaps we should use next month’s for the additional store items?
>
> Thanks
> Michelle
>
> From: Heath Maguire <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
> Sent: Saturday, March 21, 2020 4:27 PM
> To: Michelle Mowbray <michelle@readytoread.com.au <mailto:michelle@readytoread.com.au>>
> Subject: Re: On-Demand - monthly direct debit
>
> Hi Michelle,
>
> Sure, confirming I have updated the product information page: https://readytoread.com.au/on-demand/ <https://readytoread.com.au/on-demand/> Have a look and let me know what you think?
>
> I added “with no locking contract” to hone in the monthly arrangement now.
>
> Thanks,
> HEATH MAGUIRE
> CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
> E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271
>
> <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
>
>
>
>> On 21 Mar 2020, at 3:45 pm, Michelle Mowbray <michelle@readytoread.com.au <mailto:michelle@readytoread.com.au>> wrote:
>>
>> Thanks so much Heath! With this now set up, we no longer need the free trial lesson. We’ll keep the page so we can share directly if needed, but for just $5 sign up it’s now very low risk. Could we please use the left panel now for a strong call to action to subscribe for just $5 per month? I guess they can still enter the same details but then it takes them to the subscribe page to complete the rest of their details?
>> Thanks again
>> Michelle
>>
>>
>>

>>> And here is a video on how the customer can cancel their subscription (you can also do it from the backend): https://www.loom.com/share/f6c212c039f44636a5bedc8d4f3a548e <https://www.loom.com/share/f6c212c039f44636a5bedc8d4f3a548e>

>>>>> On 17 Mar 2020, at 8:48 pm, Michelle Mowbray <michelle@readytoread.com.au <mailto:michelle@readytoread.com.au>> wrote:
>>>>>
>>>>> ﻿
>>>>> Hi Heath
>>>>> Yes please! All sounds perfect. $5 per month would be great.
>>>>> Thanks so much
>>>>> Michelle
>>>>>
>>>>> From: Heath Maguire <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
>>>>> Sent: Tuesday, March 17, 2020 6:53 PM
>>>>> To: Michelle Mowbray <michelle@readytoread.com.au <mailto:michelle@readytoread.com.au>>
>>>>> Cc: David Mowbray <david@readytoread.com.au <mailto:david@readytoread.com.au>>
>>>>> Subject: Re: On-Demand - monthly direct debit
>>>>>
>>>>> Hi Michelle,
>>>>>
>>>>> Sure, we can this as a payment option on the current form. I.e. we can give them to choice to either:
>>>>>
>>>>> Pay upfront for the term
>>>>> Pay monthly
>>>>>
>>>>> They then enter their credit card info and depending on which option they select Stripe will charge accordingly.
>>>>>
>>>>> It’s not terribly complex, all we would need to know is how much you would like to charge each month and the client can then contact you when they would like to cancel. You then simply log into Stripe and cancel their subscription.
>>>>>
>>>>> We could do this within your current Care Plan with us as we have a lot of the ‘ground work’ there already. Let me know?
>>>>>
>>>>> Thanks and speak soon,
>>>>> HEATH MAGUIRE
>>>>> CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
>>>>> E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271
>>>>>
>>>>> <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>
>>>>>

>>>>>>
>>>>>> Hi Heath
>>>>>> Could you please advise what’s involved in setting up an alternative payment option for RTR On-Demand whereby the parent enters their payment details and the amount is paid automatically each month until they cancel their subscription? Or is this all on our side through Stripe?
>>>>>> Thanks
>>>>>> Michelle
